Based on my search, I found several educational resources about Tom Sawyer, Mark Twain documentaries, podcasts, and YouTube content. Here's what I discovered:

## PBS Documentary Content

PBS has a comprehensive Ken Burns documentary series about Mark Twain that tells the story of America's best-loved author. The documentary covers Twain as "the author of a dozen books, including The Adventures of Tom Sawyer, Life on the Mississippi, and his masterpiece Huckleberry Finn". The Mark Twain documentary is available to stream on pbs.org and the free PBS App.

PBS LearningMedia offers educational content showing how Samuel Clemens' childhood experiences influenced his writing of The Adventures of Tom Sawyer, considered one of the great American novels. The educational materials help students characterize Clemens' childhood and explore how his early life experiences impacted his later work.

## Podcast Content

There are several Tom Sawyer-related podcasts available:

1. A podcast series of "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" is available on Apple Podcasts, described as "a very well-known and popular story concerning American youth".

2. Another podcast version by Loyal Books presents Tom Sawyer "in such an engaging manner that you'll want to read it all in one sitting".

3. There's also a "Tom Sawyer, Detective" podcast that follows Tom and Huck on adventures through the Mississippi River backwaters.

## Documentary Film Details

The Ken Burns Mark Twain documentary from 2001 is described as "a biographical film about the acclaimed American humourist and author". Reviews praise Burns' typical style featuring "wonderful vintage pictures and discreet music and sound accompaniment, as well as professional line-readings and commentaries".

The documentary places significant emphasis on "Huckleberry Finn and Tom Sawyer--his two most well-known and celebrated works--as representative examples of his talent".

The search results show a rich collection of educational materials about Tom Sawyer and Mark Twain available through PBS documentaries, various podcast platforms, and educational resources that cover both the literary works and the author's biographical background.
